channel.title: Posts on Zomzog's blog
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Zomzog's blog
channel.copyright: All code and content for this blog is available as [open source on GitHub](https://github.com/zomzog/zomzog.fr).

item.title: OpenApi generator inheritance
item.description: We have to create a new API with inheritance in the model. To continue with the contract first way, we will see how to write it in OAS3.

item.title: Ergodox accent without international deadkey
item.description: I try to configure an ergodox-ez keyboard with developper layout but also to be able to type french text. So I don’t want to set US-International layout because I don’t want dead key on all ' and ` when I develop.

item.title: OpenApi generator client auth token management
item.description:
In my team, we try to use a contract-first approach for our REST APIs. With multiple microservices, we need to pass user token when we call another service.

In this article, I will show how to easily pass this token with a generated RestTemplate client and Springboot.

item.title: Gitflow + Maven = JgitVer
item.description:
Gitflow is a branching model for Git where the develop branch contains staging modification and master branch contains released commits.

In this article, I will present you how we simplified maven version management to avoid merge conflict and ease our release process.

item.title: Contract-First
item.description: An updated version of api-first presentation my teamates to OpenAPI-Generator.

item.description: This presentation has been created to introduce my teamates to Junit 5 and other frameworks.

item.title: Prestashop 1.7 module
item.description:
I’ve installed a Prestashop store because…​ It’s free and open source. I need some modules like EU cookie banner and I don’t want to pay 30+€ just for that.

I looked at the community solution but I didn’t find a solution that transcended me…​ And in fact, it’s a good "hello world" example for me to learn how to create modules for Prestashop.

item.title: Springboot embeded flowable
item.description:
In this tutorial, we’ll see how to initiate a springboot project with flowable.

We will build an API to make a pony says "hello <name>" or "Eeyup" if the pony is Big McIntosh
